briefTitle: Safety and Efficacy of Lacosamide as Additional Therapy in Patients Suffering From Epileptic Tonic-Clonic Seizures
officialTitle: An Open-label, Multicenter Extension Study to Evaluate the Long-term Safety and Efficacy of Lacosamide as Adjunctive Therapy for Uncontrolled Primary Generalized Tonic-Clonic Seizures in Subjects With Idiopathic Generalized Epilepsy
summary: Assessment of long-term safety and efficacy of oral lacosamide (LCM) as an adjunctive therapy for uncontrolled primary generalized tonic-clonic seizures (PGTCS) in subjects \>= 4 years of age with idiopathic generalized epilepsy (IGE). This study will enroll subjects from the LCM SP0982 \[NCT02408523\] study.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Study Participants With Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) Over the Duration of the Treatment Period
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: From Visit 1 (Week 0) to End of Treatment Period (up to approximately 5 years)
